content.question: Which of the following best describes the role of <math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="N A D P H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>NADPH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in the process of photosynthesis?

choices.label: <math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is required for the chemiosmotic production of <math alttext="N A D P H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>NADPH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> during photosynthesis.

<math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="N A D P H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>NADPH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are necessary to initiate the Krebs cycle in photosynthesis.

<math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="N A D P H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>NADPH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are carriers of chemical energy that is used in the production of carbohydrates.

<math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="N A D P H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>NADPH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are required to boost electrons to a higher energy state in photosystems <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="N A D P H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>NADPH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are carriers of chemical energy that is used in the production of carbohydrates.
